subject: Re: [junit] Whether I must extends TestCase?
msgSnippet: Thanks I want to test a package.  If I extends my own class, it will save me lots of time.  :) I will try to do that do not extends my own class. ...
messageBody:
Thanks

I want to test a package. If I extends my own class,
it will save me lots of time. :)

I will try to do that do not extends my own class.

--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> 的正文：
---------------------------------
�ffffd2�fffffc�ffffce�ffffb0�ffffc3�fffffa
wrote:

> I want to make a test case. But I want the test
class
> extends my own superclass. How can I do that??

You cannot. Java only allows single inheritance, and
JUnit test case
classes must extend TestCase, therefore they cannot
also extend your class.

What are you trying to do that makes you want your
test case class to
extend your own class? Perhaps we can find another
solution.

(By the way, in NUnit, what you propose is possible,
because there, test
case classes do not inherit from a framework class. If
you were using C#
or VB.NET, then you would be able to do it.)

Good luck.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
